I run Heritrix of various versions on XP-Pro no problem, but usually not 
with JMX enabled.

However, when I recently did need to set up a post-1.12 development 
version with JMX, usinga suitably permissions-protected password file, 
the 'cacls' command described on this page did the trick:

   http://blogs.sun.com/jmxetc/entry/the_hidden_command_that_would

As the page notes, 'cacls' might not work for a FAT32 volume.

- Gordon @ IA

xdelox wrote:
> Hi,
> I'm trying to run Heritrix 1.12.0 on a PC with Windows Xp PROFESSIONAL
> SP2, but unsuccesfully. I've already widely used the same version on
> Win XP HOME EDITION, but I don't remember any problem in
> configuration. I only remember I've replaced the jmxremote.password
> where need and replaced @PASSWORD@ with letmein in those file.
> 
> When I try, from command line, to launch heritrix in this way, the
> output is like the follow lines:
> 
>> - Login and password have not been specified (see --admin switch)
>> - another program uses the port for the web UI (8080 by default)
>  (e.g. another Heritrix instance)
>> - JMX password file is missing or permissions not set correctly
> 
>> Do you want to try to fix the permissions (Y/N)?
> 
> When I choose Y, it returns this second set of output:
> 
>> Restart Heritrix (Y/N)?Y
>> WARNING: It's currently not possible to run Heritrix in background  
>      >on Windows. It was just started minimized in a new Window and
> will be >shut down as soon as you log off.
> 
>> Either fixing the permissions failed or there was another problem.
>> You may have to set the ownership of the file 
>> \Programmi\Java\heritrix-1.12.0\jmxremote.password
>> manually to yourself (%USERNAME%) and restrict the access to >read-only.
> 
> where %USERNAME% is my username in windows account.
> 
> I've read the FAQ and all the correlated articles
> (http://www.cip.ifi.lmu.de/~schoefma/howto/run_heritrix_on_windows/
> for example).
> 
> I also tried to modify permission in all the way. 
> What's wrong? Please help me!
> 
> Thanks
> xdelox
>
